Jim Cheesman wrote:
> 
> Great - I'll add it - with one caveat. A decent editor like ultraedit will
> do all your regex will, and a lot more safely...

The "safe" way to do it would be to save the files in version control
first.  :}  But sadly, i doubt half the industry has even heard of
version control, much less uses it effectively.  The find | xargs perl
regex approach is as safe as any mechanism that doesn't provide visual
confirmation of every edit, and it's far faster if the number of files
is substantial.  Of course, the same thing could be done on a
file-by-file basis in emacs, vi, or any other real programmer's editor. 
But i'll bet even fewer programmers are using professional-grade editors
than are using version control.  At best, they use whatever
point-and-drool junk is included with their IDE.  At worst, they use
Notepad.

Sorry about that little rant.  I guess i'm just bitter at the sorry
state of affairs in my industry, and the widespread ignorance of basic
tools and programming techniques like version control, decent editors,
and regular expressions (not to mention unit testing!).  Far too often,
i see programmers trying to press a nail into a board with their bare
hands, and complaining that their hand hurts.

> And congratulations on writing the first entry ;)

Maybe if i'm feeling ambitious i'll write a few more.  :}
